text: Hi guys ... is there a way to disable zooming on mobile devices? this used to do the trick: ```maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no``` but looks like is not working

I would recommend against disabling zoom. This article helps to explain some reasons: <http://adrianroselli.com/2015/10/dont-disable-zoom.html>  Mainly though, I wouldn't do it to conform with WCAG2.0 Section 1.4.4 - <https://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#visual-audio-contrast-scale>

I agree. Unless there is an absolute reason you are disabling zoom, and that would be to enhance user experience. I generally can't think of any reason how disabling zoom would improve user experience.

I see your point but :slightly_smiling_face: ... disabling zoom will leave the only option available for the user just scrolling up and down. Basically "stop playing around ... scroll down, fill in the form, and do what you came to do on this page in the 1st place" ... something along those lines.
do you have a url of the page so we can take a look at it, there may be other options to accomplish what you are looking to do (like a cta that will bring them right to form or something else)
i do have all that ... in my opinion, if there's a way to break things or take you away from the normal use of something, people will do exactly that ... so better remove it.
see how the pinterest button is replaced by a new version of the button outomaticaly ... any idea on that one?

are you using any scripts from pinterest? For instance the hover over images to share. Was this added to the site (I only ask because we don't use pinterest) or is this native pinterest sharing through HubSpot?
